intro: Legousia speculum-veneris var. maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan Venus' Looking-glass, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that resemble a mirror. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety maroccana is distinguished by its unique floral structure and coloration compared to the typical form of Legousia speculum-veneris.
